timeline.bodyText: We need to add this in here?
timeline.author: saintstack

replies.bodyText: For used as procedure store, this is not necessary. This is for preparing for storing root table in the future, as for root table, the row key is the same with meta table, and we need to use a special comparator. I think it is fine to change the comparator in the future?
replies.author: Apache9

timeline.bodyText: How comes we can drop these methods?
timeline.author: saintstack

replies.bodyText: We will return MasterRegion directly after this change, so we do not need these methods any more, users can use the methods in MasterRegion directly.
replies.author: Apache9

timeline.author: ndimiduk

timeline.bodyText: Having everything use a single region has me a little nervous. Seems like it'll make it easy for two unrelated subsystems to step on each others' toes later on -- conflicting row keys, columns, &c. This should be fine for initial work though.
timeline.author: ndimiduk

replies.bodyText: The idea is to use different families. There is a known risk that, if someone stores a lot data in one of the families, it will slow down the start up of the whole HMaster, even if it is not necessary. We should document this in our ref guide. Can be a follow on issue?
replies.author: Apache9

timeline.bodyText: We still need the wrapper class with delegation? How about have the factory manage creation of the HRegion (wiring up the wal, &c) and HMaster hold the instance of HRegion directly?
timeline.author: ndimiduk

replies.bodyText: This is intentional. You can see the implementation of MasterRegion.update, we have to call flusherAndCompactor.onUpdate(); after each update. So if we expose the HRegion directly, the callers have to do this by their own, and I believe it will be easy to forget and then cause big problem...
replies.author: Apache9

timeline.bodyText: If this configuration point is specific to master side, should it have master in its name?
timeline.author: ndimiduk

replies.bodyText: For now it is only used in HMaster but I do not think it should be prefixed with hbase.master, as it is a configuration for HRegion.
replies.author: Apache9

timeline.bodyText:
It's a little nit-pick, but I like my configurations to specify components via .-separator, and use _ for component names. So this might be hbase.master.region.use_meta_cell_comparator.
Of course, this might be conflicting with other configuration names and uses. Would need to look things over to see what else is using the "hbase.master" namespace.
timeline.author: ndimiduk
